text:
I cannot understand the raves for this place.  The forgettable experience began before we even got through the door.  The heavy glass door does not swing easily but the three staff member standing just inside just stared without offing assistance.   
The service never got any better.  
The hostess was better suited for an Outback, too casual and familiar for a place with $50 lobster.
Our waitress finally sashayed over with an air of condensation, like we should know who she once was but isn't now.  
Neither the waitress nor the helper cold find the energy to step around next diner when serving the plates and drinks.  He was probably never taught how to serve, she was probably just lazy and annoyed. 
Did I mention that there were only three other diners, a booth of two and a table of one.
The food was fine, exactly what should be expected for those prices.  I had duck and shrimp tacos.  
This first visit will be our last!

We will never go back to this restaurant. The quality of food was not good and au jus sauce for prime rib smelled and tasted aweful.  So we asked a waiter if they prepared with special seasonings or spice.  She came back to us and said this is not Teriyaki sauce, of course and it's au jus sauce.  We were shocked and we looked each other and asked for a check.  The food quality and price don't match. Oh, one another thing, don't expect to have 6 pieces of escargot when you order.  They serve you 3 pieces of escargot and 3 pieces of scallops.  Very disappointed...

UNBELIEVABLE FAILURE ON CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

RUDE, NEGATIVE MANAGEMENT WITH INCOMPETENT PEOPLE SKILLS!!!

My fiance and I are getting married on the strip at Caesar's Palace in March. We decided we wanted to do our reception here at Second Street Grille for a party of 22 guests. 

After calling months in advance to place a reservation and talking to 3 different managers (each giving me a different answer on whether or not they could take the party), they decided they DID NOT WANT OUR BUSINESS.

I talked to the Operations Manager by the name of  KIRBY who started off our conversation with a negative and confrontaional tone. He said they will not be taking the party. When I asked for an explanation, I was told they cater to "high rollers" and can't accomadate our party. He then continued to talk over me and finally, while I was in mid-sentence, hung up the phone.

I was willing to give this establishment thousands of dollars worth of business, but was turned down because of a unknown reason. I WILL BE MORE THAN HAPPY TO NEVER SET FOOT IN YOUR PLACE EVER AGAIN.
I almost don't want to share how great this place is. The quality of food vs. price you would pay at an upscale restaurant is unmatched.  The staff is wonderful, so accommodating!
This place is amazing. Definately not your typical steakhouse. Not only is the food cooked to perfection but it is also beautiful.  The staff was very attentative. I will recommend to Everyone

They did not have sparkling water to drink. The one fellow did not know what a wine list was, and to my surprise no mint jelly with the lamb. This  was the hold back on 5 stars.
Now other than that the food was super and the cost  was excellent.
My big suggestion; always have a wine list handy. Always !!!!!!!!!
TFS

Excellent food, service, and atmosphere!
My father and I had Ahi Sashimi and Alaskan Crab.  We could't finish the crab. It was so sweet and moist.  I love the fact that it was halved and perfectly seasoned. No messy fingers to eat these delicious crab.  Nice place to take a significant others for a fancy crab dinner without the mess!
Great service in an old school steak house setting.  Glad we found this moderately priced gem off the beaten path.

My husband and I have been dining at Second Steet Grill for several years.  The new menu is excellent with a diverse offering of everything of appetizers, steaks, seafood and desserts.  We love the staff who take care of our every need.

To Tristan C., what is wrong with asking if you need a wine list?  You are the kind of person who would say that they are trying to sell you wine if offered the list?  Also, it is very rude to refer to a staff member as an old lady.  We know who you are talking about and the person is not an "old lady", has worked at Second Street Grill since it opened and is one of the best servers we have ever experienced.   Tony and Jesus are also excellent servers.
This is a hidden gem. Great service and food for a good price. Kind of hidden but worth finding it.

Ok so I left one review on this place but 
My hubby and I returned the following night and had the lamb chops ...OMG awesome well seasoned tender and juicy we sat at the bar Brian the bartender and Leslie the hostess took such good care of us we never made it to the table !!! All in all I had a good time here in tucked away in the Fremont Casino

Deliciously fun time at the Second Street Grill. We went for a company dinner as we stumbled upon the place. The staff were great, particularly Leslie, Gloria, and Francisco. Be sure to order the lamb chops; about five double chops glazed and tasty. I'll happily come back for these.

The miso glazed butterfish was inedible. It tasted like it was bathed in soy sauce - way too salty.
The mozzarella and tomato "salad" was basically a soup - drenched in dressing.

Best Alaskan King Crab around...period!

The Second Street Bar & Grill is definitely an upscale treasure sitting cozily in the Fremont Hotel & Casino. Quiet, cozy, and the perfect escape from the casino floor. Casual to upscale attire recommended and this wouldn't be a good place if you have kids. It's somewhere people would go to find a cozy quiet dining experience only feet from the casino floor. 

The grill specializes in American cuisine with Pacific Rim influence including a unique array of fine dishes including steak, fresh seafood and poultry. As an appetizer we had the Hunan pork and beef lettuce wraps. This could easily have been an entree for 2 on it's own. Flavor is top notch and the portion was huge.

As an entree, I had the Alaskan King Crab legs (38) and it was the largest serving of crab, perfectly served, and the BEST crab I've ever eaten in my life. It was a steal at a $38 market price. The crab stuffed prawns (28) were HUGE and just as filling. 

Side dishes, like the salad and baked potato, weren't bad but were average. Dessert, which I barely had room for but couldn't resist, was awesome. I chose the Cheesecake and it was one of the best I have had. Dessert is $4 with purchase of an entree...otherwise it would be $7. Well priced either way. 

Our waiter was Tony, who appeared to be the only waiter on shift. Tony and the busboy were perfectly timed and were on top of everything and everyone dining. 

Be aware that they seem to only be open after 5pm and they are not open every day...reservations don't appear to be necessary but I'd recommend it if you're going to dine there on a Fri, Sat, or Sun.

Spend-o-meter: expect to spend $100 for 1 app, 2 entrees, dessert, and sodas. 
Value: very good
Service: top notch
Negatives: none

This place was pretty damn good! Ribeye and lamb were amazing, salmon and filet with lobster were both good. Our server, Gloria, was awesome and put up with our groups shenanigans like a freaking champ. Will be back!

We had reservations on New Years Eve and all I can say is the food was amazing. First off for appetizers we ordered the escargot and scallops which was amazing scallops were cooked perfect. We also ordered the Chinese Caesar salad which was huge! It could literally feed three people easily and was so delicious. 

For dinner my husband had the rack of lamb which he said was the best rack of lamb he's ever tasted. I ordered the chicken breast that was also super delicious! Desert was delicious we had both the chocolate and raspberry cheesecake. The chocolate too rich for me but the raspberry was perfect! 

Restaurant wasn't too busy for NYE and was very nice and quiet and we really enjoyed the food. I would of gave 5 stars but the waiter took a little too long to take our orders and would hang by our table and talk too much while we were trying to enjoy our dinner. Other then that it was a great last meal of 2016!

I love this place! Seriously - great steak and lobster for $38? And a tender t-bone for $22! A very attentive waiter from the old school who made us all feel like we were the only people in the world? Tony - you are the epitome of courteous service! You are the best. To top it off with the lightest Napoleon I can remember eating in a long time...dinner was simply wonderful. AND the bar stocks Koloa rum...we will come back!

We rediscovered this place last Saturday night. What an awesome experience! From the HOT! sourdough bread, to the sampling of desserts that we tried, everything was absolute perfection.
Our orders spanned the menu. From the King crab legs, different cuts of steak, to duck and lamb. All of it was was delicious and perfectly prepared. 
We will definitely be visiting more often.

This is my favorite steak house in Las Vegas. You get a great meal at a very reasonable price. Your meals incluse your side dishes, which is nice.  The food quality is amazing, and the service is usually good (ask for Tony).  I've had the rib eye steak, seafood alfredo, and several appetizers, all were amazing.

Wow!  May have been the best rib-eye I've ever had, especially for the price!  I am so glad we discovered this place while staying at the Nugget - it is just across the street in the Fremont Casino.  Excellent service on top of excellent food (with hearty portions)... 
I ordered my steak medium well and it was cooked perfectly.  I'll be back!

Even though it's in the Fremont Casino, its a Fancy Restaurant w/ DELICIOUS food. My favorite is the Asian Chicken Cesar Salad & Rib eye. The Salad is SOOOO GOOD, our Vegas group always has to eat there, every time. I crave for that salad & order it as my entree, most of the time. And most unique is the Duck Tacos, which I don't eat duck, but everyone else seems to LOVE them.

Last night 5 of us had dinner.  We had Hunan Pork and Beef Wrap for appetizer. We had Ribeye and New York steaks. All were excellent. I always have the Gorgonzola on my steak.  Have eaten here several times, one in party I'd taken before, 3 were first timers. Always the food is excellent. Besides the food what makes this a stand out is the servers. Tony, who I always request was not working. Jesus was our server and exually excellent. Will continue to come here whenever in Vegas. Highly recommended.

When I go to Vegas, I am there to visit family and enjoy some gambling and food.  I stay and play like a local, so I prefer to spend my time and money Downtown.  The Strip is great for tourists, people who like to party and families with kids, but I am none of those, so I don't miss the glitz and glamour of The Strip.

My favorite upscale restaurant to eat at (and I eat there at least once every visit) is Second Street Grill inside The Fremont Hotel.  It is a Pan-Asian steakhouse with lots of great seafood and steak.  It is a little hard for wheelchairs to get in and out, but they will work with you to make sure everyone is comfortable.  The ambience is classy with low-lighting and the casino noise is pretty much nil (until someone opens the door and even then it's not bad).  The service is usually great (They have occasional slammed-busy nights) and the busboys, waitstaff and hostesses do a great job.

I love the food here - not only is the presentation nice, but the choices are varied and quality is excellent.  There are a few dishes that I have not liked as much as others, but that happens and it's subjective.

Appetizers are big and can be shared between 2 people - I highly suggest the caprese salad ((Fresh tomato slices, chopped basil, balsamic vinegar and beautiful fresh mozzarella cheese) , the soft-shell crabs (Crispy and tender and so flavorful!),  the Peking duck tacos (A little messy, but so yummy!) or the sashimi (Super fresh and delicious).  The shrimp cocktail is also really good with gigantic tiger prawns cooked to tenderness (not rubbery and over-cooked) served with a really good cocktail sauce.

For entrees, the steaks are always good - the filet mignon is tender and flavorful and the New York and Ribeye steaks are big and meaty.  The pork is thick and juicy and the whole fish is really tender and a great presentation.  The only entree I have had where I was disappointed has been the Tempura -- The batter was thick and heavy and I didn't care for it.

One of my favorite entrees is the lobster tail.  The lobster tails are HUGE - I am talking the meat, out of the shell is gigantic.  Not only is the lobster huge, it tastes great and they will remove it from the shell for you if you ask them to.  The drawn butter is served over a candle to stay warm and melted throughout the meal.

The desserts here are really good.  They have changed them recently, so the creme brulee is no longer available, but the ice cream is always good!

This place is not cheap, but it is completely worth the money to get away from the noise of Las Vegas and enjoy an intimate and fabulous meal.  Most people shun the Downtown areas as being low-rent and where losers and old folks hang out.  What they don't know is their loss - in my opinion, the gambling is better Downtown and with Second Street Grill tucked away in the Fremont, the food is great.

What a great find! The food was spectacular! Their tomato and mozzarella salad was the best I've ever had! Awesome filet mignon and New York Strip. There seemed to be a lot of locals and repeat customers as the waitress knew just about everyone who came in. The decor is a little dated but great experience overall.

Our family has been eating here for years... It's a favorite for special occasions and the food is really good. My favorite is the Alaskan King Crab Legs. I almost always have them. Hubby had the salmon and enjoyed it. All meals come with a salad. I also had their clam chowder that the soup du jour and it was delicious! Even their warm bread is delish! 

Reservations are recommended as they can get busy. A great, cozy restaurant that has been  a family favorite for years.

Very very good. The staff was very friendly. The food was amazing. The Crab Cakes as an appetizer might have been some of the best I've ever had. (They were so good, my wife gave me half of hers because she saw the sparkle in my eye)

Highly recommended.

The food is excellent, however the service was lacking. Our Filipina waitress was gruff and clearly not interested in attending to her tables.  We arrived early, so it was not busy. Imagine, not being able to get a copy of the receipt even though the transaction was just processed. Plain laziness. The restaurant was dimly lit so bring a flashlight to read the menu and see the entrees which were very pretty. The service or lack of can make or break a fine dining experience. As a loyal Boyd patron I visit 8-10 times a year, however will stick to Redwood. Disappointing. However food was excellent, but service non existent.

We were suspect when we walked into the casino, but pleasantly surprised with the quiet ambiance and cheerful and friendly reception at the door. We were seated in a large booth and quickly greeted by our good natured waiter Tony. We weren't expecting much from the wine menu, but again pleasantly surprised by the selection of good wines at good prices....we got an Italian Pinot Grigio for around $28. I got the prime rib, a hearty and delicious cut for under $30...dinners came with salad and potato at no extra cost. My friend got a salad and the dim sum app, and really enjoyed that too. Our waiter Tony continued to check on us and the service was excellent.
To top it off the hostess Charlene was an absolute delight and we really enjoyed her good nature and attention to us and the other patrons. U can't beat having a really good meal for 2 with bottle of wine and a 20% tip and get out for around $90! We highly recommend this place as an excellent "sleeper" off the strip in the Fremont area!!

I wanted to eat Alaskan King Crab Legs and thought we would try there.  Nice ambience, great staff.  Located in Fremont, we walked over from Main Street.  I order the crab and my husband ordered the Thai Cioppino.  The portion of crab was huge - I had to give my husband some and he was having a hard time finishing his Cioppino.  My crab came with salad and a baked potato.  The Cioppino came with a salad.  We were pleasantly stuffed and couldn't even look at the dessert menu.  I recommended this restaurant to my boss, and his friend already made reservations for their upcoming trip.  Awesome and if I could give more than five stars, I would!

We stumbled into this hidden gem amidst the hectic tourist ridden casino on our way to Tony Roma's (my bf loves it there) and we were surprised by how nice the ambience and servers were. The prices were incredibly less for what we'd pay for and the quality of the food and presentation were excellent. I ordered the queen size prime rib medium an my bf ordered the snapper. Both entrees were very fresh and very well seasoned. The service took a bit longer, but in my opinion, in restaurants similar to this one, you don't want to rush through your meal, unless you want Tony Roma's.

What a nice surprise! My wife and I are visiting Las Vegas after over 20 years. We hopped on the Hop on Hop off bus and ended the night in downtown. We ditched the tour and had dinner here. From first couple minutes we felt very welcome. Our waitress Pam was so friendly and knowledgeable. The food was amazing and bountiful! We finished the meal with a great chocolate explosion. I would highly recommend this restaurant quality, attention to detail and superb service.

Wow what a relief.  Was afraid I was going to end up in some crappy Vegas buffet. You find yourself walking through downtown Vegas certain that you are NEVER going find a decent place for Dinner and stumble into the Fremont, poke your head into the Second St Grill and instantly you know you are in a good place.  The service and food are OUTSTANDING.  I am a steak snob and the Rib eye here was better the the one I had at the Billagio, no I am not kidding.  The staff makes you feel comfortable, were very attentive and knowledgable.  Very clean, unlike the tpyical downtown places and even compared to the Fremont Casino.  The menus has a great selection, steak seafoods, pastas, salads.  We had dinner for two without drinks for $55.  Not a downtown fan at all but I would make the trip again just to eat here.  A nice break from the street circus.

Quiet restaurant within the Fremont hotel. It's a bit of a challenge finding this restaurant because you have to walk through the slot machines and gaming tables. Upon entering the darkened foyer, your eyes are treated to an elegant room with plush intimate booths. Tables for larger parties of 10-12 can be seated in the middle of the room. 

The escargot and scallop appetizer ($16) was delicious. The rack of lamb ($37) was tasty and grilled to perfection. The star entree IMO was the crab legs ($44). A full pound and a half of sweet, tender king crab legs served with drawn butter. My dinner mates had the prime rib and seafood cioppino, saying it was very good.  The stuffed shrimp with pasta was disappointing because it was deep fried and dry. All entrees came with a starch and cooked veggie, a small dinner salad and complimentary sour dough bread. You can bring your own wine and the corkage is $10. Our server this evening did an excellent job and was very efficient. I highly recommend this restaurant and would return if I stay in the Fremont hotel.

Delicious! This place is great and serves a variety of different meals. My (very picky) family was left impressed. Our server was named Jesus. Customer service was excellent. I would recommend this place to anyone that's looking for a delicious meal at a reasonable price. We ordered the lettuce wraps, ribeye (more than one all cooked differently), escargot, and cheesecake.  We were impressed at how perfect everything came out. No complaints! We definitely plan on coming back.

So good, we ate there twice!

We had the pleasure of stumbling across Second Street Grill during our most recent trip Downtown in August. We stayed at the Fremont Casino and Hotel and did not feel like venturing out to find something to eat, and we thought we would stop in for the T-bone special for $22.95. 

The decor of the restaurant was very quaint,  subtle and classy with perfectly dim lighting. Wait staff was attentive, friendly, and on top of everything; our glasses never went empty! 

On our first visit, we opted not to get the T-Bone special. Instead, we went with the Chipotle Rib Eye, and Mongolian Rack of Lamb. Both were phenomenal, well seasoned, and cooked to perfection. We had the crab cakes as an appetizer and they were delightful. You could not have received a better meal at a better price at any of the higher end steakhouses on the Strip, that's for sure. 

We were so impressed with the service and food quality that we went back a few nights later for a second feast. This time, we both took advantage of the T-Bone special, and I can't imagine a better meal for the money. The salad dressing on the house salad was incredible, and the bread basket was delicious. Steaks were perfectly done, seasoned well, extremely tender, and we ordered ours with loaded baked potatoes. Don't forget to order desert!

All in all, Second Street Grill is an amazing hidden gem in Downtown. If you are staying or playing at the Fremont (which we both love), you couldn't ask for a better restaurant.

We are making another trip to the Fremont in November, and we already have our reservations made for Second Street Grill. Can't wait!

OK; I am updating my reviews because I am seeing unfavorable reviews lately for this restaurant.  My daughter and I were there on 10/26 for dinner.  As always, we had a good dinner with good service.  They put back the whole, deep-fried fish on the menu and I ordered that cause I love it.  I couldn't figure out what kind of fish it was, but it was fine.  My D ordered crab legs and she said it was fine too.  Gloria was our server, as I always ask for her.  She has done a great job for me over the decades and decades that I have been going here and she was great to us again.  So I guess I do not understand the negative reviews of others recently.

I didn't even get a chance to taste the food before I can add a review. Our waitress was extremely rude and clearly overstepped her bounds with my food. My party was a party of 7 so the bill and tip was going to be fairly large. I ordered the Alaskan king crab legs and asked what it came with and was told a side salad and a baked potato. So I said ok let me go ahead and order this. She asked what was my dressing I asked what did they have was told all the dressings then my friend said I got a Caesar salad. So she said do you want Caesar dressing or a Caesar  salad we both agrees on the salad. So the apps arrived and out drinks and them the "Caesar" salads come out. It's a chicken Caesar salad not a side salad. So I asked why did she bring this and she said it's what I asked for I told her no I assumed it was a dinner salad not a full on meal salad. She was very rude and them said I didn't have to eat the salad and she took it off the table. I them has to tell her to put my food back on the table and she still was making comments about what I asked for. I had to get kinda rude and tell her just leave it. I'm very disappointed at the level or service I received and that's taking away from the overall experience.

When our friend wins big, we all win big! 

Thanks to Jeff V. for inviting us out for a lobster & crab feast after his lucky weekend in Sin City! We're so glad he introduced us to this cozy lil steak house tucked inside of the Downtown Fremont Hotel & Casino. This place is a hidden treasure! The restaurant is dimly lit and has an old school steak house vibe; really unpretentious. The decor evokes a 1920s atmosphere with rich colors, wood paneling and faux marble pillars; but on a budget. We lifted up the tablecloth to find a vintage padded dealer's table with a cigarette burn. Thats old Vegas alright! There's also a small bar area to the right when you enter. Casual attire is fine, but you can surly bring your date here. The pricing is reasonable and the portion sizes are great!

All you need to know is Alaskan King Crab and Australian Lobster Tail! Both were extremely meaty and sweet. Cooked to succulent perfection. There was so much meat, we had to take a doggy bag home! They go all out on presentation here, the plates looked fantastic! The lobster was presented beautifully on a huge plate with pesto mashed potatoes (extremely dry and unedible) and stir-fry vegetables with lemon ginger butter sauce (they're alright.) But the shellfish were the star of the show and equally incredible! Rated: 5/5

The entrees also come with a simple side spring salad and your choice of dressing. Get the Bleu cheese dressing. Rated: 3/5

We also shared the Tempura appetizer which comes with soft shell crab, tiger prawns, assorted vegetables. The batter was fried golden and crispy, but it was way too thick and heavy. Rated: 2/5

Would I come back? Hell to the YEAH. But let it be known, the shellfish is where it's at! Thanks Jeff V!

We had dinner here 6.7.18.  It was a good experience service wise... food wise, well... not as good.  We both ordered the surf and turf; filet and lobster.  Crab cake for appetizers.

Our apps came out quickly, but the main course took an exceptionally long time.  It wasn't that big of a deal because we were caught up in an interesting conversation.  However, when our food arrived, I was a little disappointed.  I had ordered my steak medium, while my friend ordered hers medium well.  Mine was right around medium well and hers was well done; due to it being butterflied.  Our server Pam offered to take it back and prepare a new one, but it wasn't her fault so I just declined and said I will eat the well done steak.  It was still good, just not as juicy of course.

I give Pam an extra star because of her service and kind attitude.

I may try again, may not... just depends on where we are when we are hungry.

Excellent! Beautiful ambiance, amazing service. Waiter offered to get my husband some apple pie and ice cream for desert from buffet to Make him happy. We all know hat doesn't happen everywhere! I had the surf and turf and while it wasn't on the menu and I had to ask for it, WONDERFUL, tender and moist is all I can say. Don't dare eat at Tony Romas when this is just over the wall!

Great experience at this place... BYOB in Vegas - really? Yes! We brought along a couple of our own nice bottles of wine and paid a small corkage fee. The portion sizes are HUGE so it's a good idea to share a meal. We had the stuffed pork chop that was so moist and juicy and it was paired with mashed potatoes and string beans. Warm rolls with butter and garlic were served prior to our meal arriving. Our friends got the steak special that looks awesome too.  Everything was very good. I'm adding this place as a definite go-to for every Vegas trip now.
The food here is amazing and reasonably priced too!!! I was so glad we chose to eat here. The Ribeye is so good... I highly recommend it.

Absolutely amazing!!  My friends and I literally wandered into this restaurant at the recommendation of the bartender on the casino floor where we had stopped for a drink.  We thought for sure he was simply recommending the hotel's restaurant as "the best around" for marketing purposes.  I can't put to words what an incredible dining experience this was.  Our server was amazing, the food was absolutely incredible, the steaks were huge and cooked to perfection, the bartender, manager, server, busboys were all incredibly professional, attentive to our needs and it was easy to tell they enjoyed their work.  By far one of the best meals my friends and I have ever had.  You could put this restaurant in the heart of midtown Manhattan and it would fit right in.  Will definitely be going back on our next trip to Vegas!!  Thanks so much for the wonderful fine dining experience!!

Most amazing food and service.  Must have the scallops and escargot appetizer. .. lamb and thai cioppino is out of this world and napoleon accompanied with kona coffee from a french press tops the meal.  Tony and others provide only 5 star service.

This is a gem of a place in the midst of crazy, cheap gambling. Make a reservation - the place fills up, especially on a Sat night. 

Place was packed - lots of diners ordering $35 steaks, escargot, and $15 sashimi. The lamb chops were particularly good - for $37. perfectly cooked and tasty. No gamey smell or taste for the lamb. 

We also ordered the whole fried snapper - was told it was good, but it was way over cooked and dry. Meat was tough and hard, I wouldn't order it again for that reason. It was pricey at $55, thought it would be worth it. Meh. 

Buffalo mozzarella was large enough to share with the whole table - mozzarella - excellent, though a little drowned in balsamic. 

Miso butter fish was the best dish - black cod was marinated perfectly and very tasty. 

Ambiance is loud, tables are very close to each other but the butterfish and lamb chops were worth it. 

We were almost too full to have dessert so only ordered plain vanilla ice cream, it came with marinated pineapple. 

We would return again -  a good meal without driving very far if ou stay downtown.  If you drive. Parking is by valet only unless you park somewhere else and walk in.

I had called the restaurant over a month before to make a reservation for my husbands b-day dinner. I had spoken with the manager in charge that night and requested a table in the back and not too noisy so we could enjoy a b-day celebration for 6 of us.  He kept repeating what I was requesting and told me not to worry that they would be happy to take care of us.  He had even asked if we wanted any particular server.  Well, we show up at the restaurant on Monday 6/22 and the hostess (who identified herself as the manager) proceeded to seat us in the front room in the middle of the restaurant.  I asked her if she could seat us in the back as I had called several weeks ago  etc, and she proceeded to tell me that she was the manager and she didn't know anything about it. She acted like because she didn't know it wasn't her fault.  And she had the nerve to ask if we could wait about a half hour until the big group in the back left and she could seat us in the back then.  I was furious- she was rude and didn't even have the manners to apologize.  I told her we were leaving and she picked up the menus and went back to stand at her hostess stand without saying a word.  This was totally unacceptable- I couldn't believe how unprofessional she was.  She clearly could have cared less about our business.  I guess someone forgot to tell her that no one will go back to a restaurant with bad service no matter what the food tastes like.  A smile, an apology, a drink while we waited would have gone a long way.  Needless to say, I will never go back to this restaurant and neither will I let anyone else I know go back there.  Someone better start paying attention to the front of the house there if they hope to have any repeat customers. They deserve NO STARS!!

This place is an awesome getaway if you're looking to escape the bright lights, thumping pop  music or electronic sound effects of slot machines.  Sure you have to walk through all of that to get to Second Street Grill inside the Fremont Casino, but once you're there it's worth it.  This is one of the best values in Vegas.  Don't make the mistake of going to Tony Roma's next to it!  That place can't cook a steak to save their lives!  A King Cut prime rib at Second Street is under $30 and on Fridays you can get a big T-bone, mushrooms, green beans, baked potato and salad for $22.99.  The atmosphere is nice with dimmed lights and soft piano music and the service is quick.  We took a team of 6 hungry salesmen who all got steaks (cooked to perfection of course) and we were in and out in under an hour.  Second Street Grill is a great break from the noise of Las Vegas and an even better value for your dollar!

Very bad experience. Last meal before our flight. In casual clothes and we are told if we share we will be charged extra. No explanation of why. Meanwhile every person of our party has ordered a dish. I go to speak with the manger/hostess and ask what the charge is for and she states it says it on the menu. I asked if she could express a little more on why and she states because we do. During our time seated the manager/hostess is getting fed from a customer eating on the table next to us. I hope he got charged. Lol but of course he has comps and they are definitely catering more to him.
The food is great but the service is terrible.

This place was a great find. We were allowed to eat at the bar. Brian was so attentive and friendly. The hostess and servers were also very friendly. We went for appetizers and drinks; had escargot and crab cakes. Excellent!  Can't wait to go back for their prime rib and lobster for only $38, the lobster is 8oz. Also the dining room is beautiful with dark wood. Prices are very reasonable for an upscale restaurant

I love Cioppino, and whenever I travel it is one of the first dishes I yelp.  I was pleasantly  suprised to see a unique "Thai Cioppino" on the menu here when traveling in downtown Las Vegas.  It lived up to my expectations!  The best sign of a good Cioppino is the amount of shells you need to discard and I filled the shell bowl to the brim.  The Cioppino however, was not the best part of the meal, it was actually the service.  Extremely friendly and attentive, I felt like I was eating at a five star restaurant.  Bravo!

We wanted to eat good prime rib so decided to come here since our friends really liked this place, our waitress has ties in Hawaii so for us it was like we were home and she was very nice and made our experience well worth it, I had the prime rib "king cut", and it was awesome, it was so tender and I couldn't resist eating the fat. We also had dessert and that was very good also. Next time I am in Vegas I will definitely visit them again.

I loved this place. The duck with blackberry glaze was great and the only duck i could find on fremont st. The atmosphere was calm and relaxing. The service was perfect. Tony my server was excellent. The chefs have been here over 20 years and they got skills.  Loved it.

Excellent atmosphere and service!!  If you are at Fremont and want to eat somewhere special, then this is the place!  Split the ribeye and it was thick, juicy and huge!  The food was very good, but barbecue on steak is not really my thing.  I will go back again!  Really loved the service!

The food deserves four stars but because of the service, I give only three stars-- didn't see waitress for first fifteen minutes we were there (the place wasn't busy at all) and the hour and a half we were seated she came to our table three times. If in Vegas again though, I would definitely come back because the 'linguine with shrimp and scallops in a mascarpone cream sauce' was absolutely incredible. The three friends I was with all had the T-bone steak and were very pleased as well. Thank you for such a wonderful menu!

Will never go back to this restaurant again; the service was terrible, server did not even get back to see if the food was done right, tried to get their attention.  Steak was over done and steamed fish was under cooked.

I will not recommend "Second Street Grill" to anyone.

The food here is great. We've had the surf and turf, crab legs, sashimi, and escargot. Every meal comes with a nice, cold fresh green salad. Romantic quiet atmosphere. Jesus is a fabulous waiter, ask for his service when you make a reservation. Stay away from Gloria's section, her service is so bad there are no words to describe it.

My friends and I went to Second Street Grill this past week and had a horrible experience. We originally chose this restaurant because of the positive reviews and it was also close to the show we were going to afterward.

We arrive at the restaurant with reservations and were immediately seated. Then we waited for 15 minutes for our server to come around...there were only about 4 other tables in the restaurant at the time. Finally our server, Gloria, comes over to our table. I asked her what the Gluten Free options were on the menu and she said we don't have anything that is Gluten Free. I was leaning toward the steak and lobster special so I asked her how that was prepared. She said there was butter, which wasn't gluten free, on the steak and lobster, and the sour cream on the baked potato wasn't gluten free either. Clearly she didn't know what Gluten was and was making stuff up as she went instead of asking the chef or someone that actually knew. Finally I said I'll take the steak and lobster and the butter was fine. Our table also asked for a side of bacon as well. The food comes out, I have a dry steak and a dry lobster...no butter on either. It was the worst steak and lobster I have ever had. The lobster tasted like it was a month old and the steak was the lowest quality steak for a $$$ rated restaurant i've ever had. 3 of us had ordered steak and not a single person had received a steak knife until we asked for one...half way through our meal because no one came by to check up on us and the bacon never came out. The server visited our table maybe 3 times during the entire dinner, once to take our order, once to give us water, and once to give us our checks. 

There are many places to eat in Vegas, don't waste your money here. Not only is the service horrible, and maybe it was just Gloria, but the food is cheap and not on par with the prices.

Ok, I am now a San Francisco snob.  If my food is not being cooked by a Top Chef reject, served by an actress/waitress, and not locally sourced at organic farms, I think it is McDonalds.

As a long time casino visitor thanks to my father's gambling interest/addiction, I have been to more buffets than my stomach can handle, so it was a nice upgrade to go to the steakhouse.  

It is classic fancy/shabby Vegas restaurant, a place which caters to the medium rollers at Fremont, who eat at home 51 weeks a year so they can blow their cash in an old time Downtown casino.  

There was nothing really interesting with the decor or service, nor do their customer base want better.  I was a little dubious about my menu selections, especially when he made me get the T-bone special (despite getting a free food comp).  

Anyway, the steak was very tasty and so was the sauteed mushrooms and the asparagus with Hollandaise sauce.  And like a big boy, I ate the whole thing, pleasing my father's choice to allow me to have a steak.

An awesome Vegas find. I'll be back when on Freemont Street! My friends had duck and another seafood. I had a t-bone steak special. Fabulous! It came with salad and sides. This was an old, old school looking place. Lovely decor, you expect Sinatra to walk in. Very low key and unpretentious while serving amazing food. Basic food, done well. (Well, except for my med rare steak, it was cooked to perfection.)

We were hungry, we were under a time crunch to get to a show and we were having trouble finding the original restaurant we wanted to go to. On Fremont Street every casino claims they're the number one restaurant or grill or café in Vegas. However we were Lured  by the sign as we passed the Fremont. We walked in it's a quiet and small place and I didn't have a lot of high expectations because my initial thinking was based on how eager they were not to see us walk through the door. I thought this would be a overall disappointment.

Quite to my surprise it was one of the best steaks I've had in a long time. I had the special T-bone and my wife had the steak salad both were absolutely awesome. Only thing I would recommend is a few up ticks on the service and would be five stars.

My meal at the Second Street Grill was A-OK.  I liked the room as it was quiet.  My server, Tony, was very good.

As with most steakhouses, all the apps are meant to be shared so I decided to try either soup or a salad.  When I found out that the salad was also for sharing, Tony told me that a house salad comes with each meal.  Win!  I ordered a cup of beef vegetable which was the soup du jour.  I didn't realize that I could have gotten a different dressing than the honey mustard that came on the house salad.  It's one of my least favorite dressings because of its sweetness.  Along with my soup, I was brought a round loaf of right out of the oven bread scored in quarters.  There were also two butters--regular and pesto.  The regular butter was the best.

I ordered the NY steak done blue.  It comes with gorgonzola cheese, mashed potatoes, and Maui onion strings.  Tony asked me if I was OK with the topping and the other items to make sure.  The steak was very rare as asked.  The Maui onion strings were completely addictive.  One thing I don't like is when a restaurant puts a layer of mashed potatoes down and then plates the steak on the potatoes.  I know it's my quirk, but I'd rather have them separate.

For dessert, I got the Kona coffee crème brûlée.  It was good but there was a strong coffee flavor.

This was an enjoyable experience and service was good.  I'm not sure of a return visit.  They're closed Monday and Tuesday and they only have valet parking.  I parked at Neonopolis and walked there.

Best dinner for the price, ordered Australian Lobster Tail, Prime Rib, Salmon, Alaskan King Crab Legs, I wish I would have taken a picture of the table of food, it tasted as good as it looked,  One of the best dinners Ive had in Vegas EVER, worth every penny.

Agree that this place is a hidden gem! Intimate with attentive service and really good food. Hard to believe this place exists in the Fremont Street Experience....  My only compliant is that the bartender did not know how to make a dry gin martini.. ( hard to believe)

Excellent food - both taste, portions and presentation.  Had a Mahi dish and shrimp/tomato soup.  

Waitress was lax but water filler was spot on. 

Nice atmosphere.

Enjoyed this place immensely.   Went there for Valentine's dinner (on Sunday not Monday - a day early) and had a reservation but didn't need one.   The place only has about 20 tables and most were empty.  What a shame because the place is great and talk about atmosphere.  I thought the Rat Pack would walk in at any moment - very elegant old Las Vegas.  The staff were so friendly and attentive.  Oh and the food was great too.  For appetizer we had the dim sum dumplings that were delicious.  For the main course, I had the miso cod with bok choy and loved it.  My partner had a steak and with cheese and loved it.    All around it was a great experience.   But don't gamble downstairs or you'll end up eating at McDonald's.

Another great dinner at 2nd street grill. Ask for Gloria, she's gives the best service and a wonderful lady! My favorite dinner here starts with the hot spinach salad, enough for two people. Then the fresh lobster! It's a quaint little place that we love. Every time in Vegas we stop in. They also have great crab legs and an asian menu too. Sushi is awesome! The restaurant is sort of hidden in the Fremont Hotel, in the casino area right around the corner from tony romas restaurant. After you're done with dinner, play the wheel of fortune. I won here!

Must have a different chef...always get butter fish and it was terrible tonight...fishy too little rice and salty undecernable veggies...my friend had surf and turf ...meat was bland and lobster chewey!  Don't mind pay $120 for two if food is great but frankly...get better for a fraction the price and my regular Emerald Island downtown Henderson.

Yup, this is that place. You gotta go!!!
Old school perfection and a staff that won't quit.

Located in the Fremont hotel and casino, this place is tucked behind the Tony Roma's.   The entrance is so plain and small, you could easily walk past it.  There are about 20 tables inside and it's darkly lit.  We had the stuffed pork chops, the T-Bone Steak and Salmon Florentine with Gorgonzola.  The pork chop was presented well, but over cooked.  It was dry and tough.  I had the Salmon which was good and flaky.  The combination of Gorgonzola and the red pepper sauce was good.  The T-Bone steak was meh.
Food was great. Gloria is not the server to get. She was terrible. The food was good enough to overshadow Gloria terrible service.
I went here for my birthday and it was the best experience I've had! They have the biggest portions here I had to take some home! I ordered the Thai Cioppino and it was delicious!

They have a whole fried snapper that is out of this world good!!!
It was off the menu for a while, but they have it back and I highly suggest going for the fish!!!!

The four stars is definitely just for the fish! (although the escargot was amazing too)
The fish is a wok fried whole fish that is prepared perfectly! They serve it with a soy dipping sauce and a tarter sauce, but the fish needs neither.... it is perfect all on its own.
The bread they bring out for the table is very fresh and I really liked the honey mustard house dressing that was on the salad.

The restaurant is located in the Fremont Hotel downtown. The location is 3 stars. It does feel very old school Vegas though.
The service is hit and miss... definitely 3 stars...they put forth an effort, but not so much of an effort to leave any kind of an impression. 
I however love good food... so atmosphere or service can take a back seat for the quality of the food!

I will be back very soon for that fish!! (Please keep it on the menu Second Street)

Amazing, amazing and amazing! Such good food here, I got the special surf and turf, filet mignon and lobster with baked potato and salad for 38$. It was hands down the best lobster I have had in over 20 years, my wife ordered the filet mignon for 32$ it came with mashed potatoes and salad and she said it was in her top five ever. The staff was very friendly.

No joke from the other reveiws! this place is great. I love downtown but lets face it you usually get what you pay for down there lol....and seeing how we were going to party down there we didnt want to spend the money on an expensive steak dinner that we would probably end up puking up anyways. But this place truly is a hidden gem! We made a reservation and as to my surprise we had a reserved table as soon as we got there.  The customer service was awesome not only from our server jose but the hostess as well as their kick-a** bartender that could actually make a singapore sling!  The ambiance in the entire place actually had me and my fiance of five years bringing back our long lost romance! The food was absolutely great  no complaint  and good portions! The rib eye was awesome! For the first time i got a bill that suprised me on how low it was.(appetizer, Two dinners,  and drinks $98....$25 or more of the $98 on drinks)  Go and enjoy!

I was surprised to find this place stuck inside the Fremont Casino.  It's a nice romantic steak house, and while you're in their you forget that you're even in a Casino. 

First they bring over bread and 3 different toppings for the bread. Butter, garlic Olive oil and an eggplant spread. All were great and the bread was fresh and warm. 

I ordered the New York Strip with gorgonzola on top. It was served on top of crispy fried onion strips, mashed potatoes and broccolini. I usually don't care for steak while out, but this was delicious. And my steak was actually delivered medium, like I ordered (something I wasn't expecting for a steak house inside a casino).

The servers were all nice and the atmosphere was relaxed and peaceful. It was a nice getaway found inside the hustle and bustle of a casino.
Great food,  portion are just right,  great atmosphere to take your spouse for a nice dinner.  Waiter was outstanding!
I think there are better options in the Downtown area. The service was great but the Loco Moco was cafeteria-style.

Met our friend here because when in town it's once of our favorites! 
Our waiter Tony.... always taking great care of us. 
Martinis are Devine. Good... "Second" to none! 
Boys had the T-Bones. Came with a beautiful large salad and green beans and sautéed mushrooms as a side. Oh and a loaded baked potato! 
Ladies..... ahi tuna seared and Shrimp/Scallop fettuccine in a marscapone cheese sauce! Amazing. 
A quiet place in this Fremont Hotel. Spectacular! Delicious! A must try!

Service and atmosphere were great. Food was just ok. The duck taco appetizer was salty and underwhelming. The blue cheese new york steak was the best thing we had. We used a certificate for $40 off but we wont be going back anytime soon.

Love this place! The portions were enormous. Went here last year with a couple friends and my boyfriend. My boyfriend had the stuff pork chops and I had the ribeye steak. The food was divine. I plan on eating here everytime I visit Vegas.

A little mixed all around but pretty good overall.  Called and asked if there were openings that evening and was told it was very slow so no reservation needed.  Didn't stop the guy who would turn out to be our waiter from glaring and mumbling when we got there and I said I had no reservation.  He also seemed annoyed that we didn't order immediately.  Maybe he mistook us for others because when he came back again, there was a complete change of attitude.  Helpful and friendly for the rest of the night.  I think the appetizers would make a better meal than ordering an entree.  The lettuce rolls were really good.  The crab cake was also good.  Neither of these was as good as the scallop and shrimp dim sum, which was excellent but overpriced.  Ordered a shrimp and vegetable tempura dinner as well but the tempura wasn't quite cooked long enough - doughey inside.  Didn't even try dessert after barely finishing half of what we ordered.

Me and my wife stumbled upon this restaurant when we were just browsing the nightlife in downtown vegas. So I made a reservation and we waltz pretty much right in since there are not really that many customers around. 

When we walk in the hostess asked if we needed the wine list. Wait? Arent you supposed to be a fine dining steak house? Maybe its because we are a couple of asian that looks to young to order any wine. Still, wine list should come automatic without asking. Weird??

When we sit down, our server an old lady showed up and asked us within the first minute, so are you ready to order? WOW!!! No what,why, if and but, just straight asking like we are at the mcdonald. AMAZING. No wonder you work in downtown, cos I dont think the strip will hired you.

The rest of the evening was pleasant, I ordered the prime rib queen size which is pretty big already and my wife ordered some fish which she enjoyed very much. All and all, the food are okay. The old busser are pretty nice, he make sure that we have our water filled almost immediately and taken all our dirty dishes. The salad that comes with the meals are pretty nice and tasty too. 

At the end of our meal, the server just pop in and drop us a check maybe hoping that we dont order any dessert so that if we stiff her its not too painful. All the more reason my wife would like to order some dessert, so we ordered the napoleon and it was wonderful. 

Dont worry, we didnt stiff the old lady, except the greet and the ending, she did an ok job and that warrant a 20 percent tips. Is there room for improvement for the management for a service training, sure. What about food, they are wonderful. Pretty good deal for the price. Will I come back? Maybe not in a little while, there are a lot of steakhouses in downtown and I heard an awesome steakhouse called Andiamo is coming soon at D Casino, cant wait to check that one out.
Great place . Fast service , better then Gordon Ramsey steak house , and half the price

Talk about going downhill.  We have been here several times before and the food was very good and a great option when you are downtown.  That has all changed. The food was mediocre at best, and certainly not worth what was being charged. They clearly changed vendors or downgraded the quality of the beef they used because all of the steaks were terrible - tough, tasteless and despite being ordered at Medium came at shoe leather - so back they went.  The worst part of the evening, however, was the atmosphere and the manger's refusal to tone down an extremely drunk and loud party of 3. I know, how can a party of 3 disrupt an entire restaurant?  Vegas, baby! They did. I have been at super bowl sports bars that were less noisy.  It is a small dining room, so one loud party allowed to do their thing will ruin (and did) the dining experience for everyone else - with the manager's blessing.  We complained to her as we left, given our complaints to the waiter were only met with stares of there is nothing I can do.  We will never be back. Take you money and go play MegaMillion.  Your odds of having a good time are far better than throwing it away here.

My husband and I have been staying at the Fremont Hotel since 2008 and we typically visit the week after the NFR and right before Christmas.  This time of year finds many of the finer restaurants (and popular shows) to be closed or dark, to do the yearly sprucing up and to give the employees holiday time with their loved ones.  

This year, we visited the first full week in February and were beyond excited to find out we could FINALLY visit the Second Street Grill.  Every year, we gaze wistfully at their posted menu, and dab a tear from our eyes as we read the sign that says 'we are closed now but will re-open on December XX' which is always the day AFTER we leave town!

This year, things were going to be VERY different!  Last year, we had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Leslie, who has over the past year, become a dear friend and we were anxious to connect again in person.  We alerted her to our impromptu visit to Vegas and promised to let her know when we'd be stopping by.  So, because we knew this evening was going to be awesome, we invited our friends along (we'll call them A and J-O) for dinner.  We had reservations for 8pm and arrived on time, to be welcomed with a big hug from our friend Leslie!  Yes, this year was going to be VERY different!  For once, we were inside, not outside with our noses pressed against the glass, hoping for a whiff of the amazing food inside!

The first thing you notice when you enter the sanctuary that is the bar is the complete lack of noise from the casino.  I have no idea how they do this, but if you didn't know you had just come from a land of clinking, clanking, smoking and laughter, you would never know the cacophony that lies beyond the front door!

The decor is understated, with subdued lighting and jewel-toned accents.  The restaurant feels very intimate and classy, without being pretentious.  Soft music, attentive service and amazing food really makes this place a 'must visit' for everyone.

Now, the main attraction - the food!  Our group started with the escargot and scallops, bathed in a garlic butter sauce.  Everyone proclaimed it to be quite delish and I can vouch for the garlic butter sauce being perfectly dippable with their amazing bread.  The sourdough bread, served warm, had a satisfying crunchy exterior and a dense and flavorful inside.  Butter and pesto butter accompanied the bread and the reviews of the pesto butter were mixed.  

A and my hubby R both opted for the surf and turf, which consisted of  a filet mignon and a lobster tail.  The food was artfully presented with the perfectly charred filet resting atop grilled mushrooms and onions and 
the lobster tail was shimmering and succulent, imploring for a dip into the drawn butter.  A flower garnish completed the artful plating and really took the entire dish over the top.   A salad and baked potato accompanied this entree as well.  

J-O ordered the bone-in ribeye, which was accompanied by green beans, a baked potato and side salad.  Again, the presentation was beautiful - with a flower and a sprig of rosemary rounding out the dish.

I selected the filet mignon, medium rare, which was crowned with a tangle of fried onion straws and accompanied by a baked potato and a salad.  The perfectly cooked steak had a char on the outside and was cool red from edge to edge - a skill very few chefs can execute time and time again.  

Everyone we encountered added to our overall experience.  The staff was professional, personable, attentive without being intrusive and really took great care in anticipating our needs.  The manager, Leslie, stopped by each table at least once during the visit and you could tell she takes great pride in her staff, her food and beverage offerings and her establishment.  From start to finish, the entire experience was a night to remember.  Yes, this year was VERY different indeed!  Thanks to everyone at SSG!  We will be back!

I went there last night after seeing the reviews here. We checked out some other dinner places in the area but decided on Second Street Grill. This place is fine dining at its best. When we went in we thought it may have a dress code because it looked like that type of place, but they had no problem accepting us in shorts and casual wear. I ordered a pasta dish and so did my GF. We were both very happy with our meal. We started with Escargot and Scallops in a garlic sauce that was excellent. Great place!

This "grill" is really an upscale restaurant located inside the Fremont Hotel and Casino. At first I wasn't too impressed, it was dark and I had to use the light from my cell phone in order to see the menu. It took forever for the waitress to take our order. It seemed like a really long time for our food to arrive also. Maybe because I was SO hungry!But when it did arrive, it was worth the wait. My steak was topped with grilled crispy onions and it was excellent. My girlfriend's steak was equally as good. It was expensive, but for a night of great dining I won't forget the night we shared at the Second Street Grill. I will be back next time!

Solid 4 stars. This was recommended by a friend so I called up my Vegas native friend to eat here....he'd never heard of it either.

We we're both pleasantly surprised. We decided to with king crab legs ($50) and surf and turf ($39). My friend got a spinach salad also and he said this one was authentic, and very good. All the food was good...lobster scoring bonus points. Steak was perfect.
Absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas we call it our hidden treasure. I've been going there since it opened.

Over the years, I have eaten at Second Street many times over.  My family has been regular guests of the California Hotel for 3 generations.  Since the Fremont is a Boyd property, we will mosey on over to Second Street for dinner every now and then.

I will say that for steaks and prime rib, the Redwood in the Cal is superior, but I find that the menu at Second Street is a tad more progressive.  I can always find something a little different than what I ate the night before.
This  place was incredible!  For $20 I got a huge delicious prime rib with bread, side salad and baked potato.  We will definitely be going back to this place next time we are in Vegas!

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night with family.  The restaurant is definitely a hidden gem in downtown Las Vegas located in the Fremont Hotel and Casino.  

We shared the Ahi Sashimi and Shrimp and Scallop dim sum for appetizer.  Both dishes were amazing!!  Perfectly cooked and flavored! For dinner I had the Bamboo steamed pacific red snapper which was served with stir-fried vegetables, shiitake mushrooms, cilantro and scallions fused with sizzling peanut oil and soy sauce.  This dish was delicious but not as good as the appetizers. 

Our server, Jesus, was very personable and informative.  I will definitely dine here again!

I am suprised there arent that many reviews of this steakhouse, it's an amazing value.  I am a local and work downtown.  Over the course of a few months I decided to try every steakhouse in the Fremont area so I knew where to take friends and family who visited.  My steak of choice is they Ribeye, and this joint delivers.  Medium rare, comes on a bed of potatoes with the crispy onions on top?  Why doesnt every steak have crispy onions on top??? Just sayin...  Add a side salad and you're good to go for less than $30.  Then take the $10 you saved on your huge steak and tip your server well!

O, who was the winner of the steak-off?  There isn't one, you're in Vegas and they all know steaks.  They aren't $1.99 though =)
